message.body: HeYa Jurgen. We meet again!
Yo, wassup?
Well, my diet lost the debate, so I'm sitting here drinking a hot chocolate, est'd 130cal.
Ah
Not much - had 2 mtgs today
Either of them get anything done, our just time-wasters?
1st was a time waste 2nd was good
Btw, is my phone #showing up at the foot of my txts?
1 for 2 isn't so bad.
Nope
Oh good
When I couldn't sleep last night, I made applesauce
Yum. Cinnamon? Other spices?
(I was just putting the beer on ice for the happy hr)
Yep & allspice & nutmeg
(bgkd music here just started Big Girls Don't Cry :-) )
Mmmmmmm!
Yep
But I think I need a nap now
Go thou and refresh thyself!
Morning!
So it is. I've just gotten up, and an getting dressed. I'll send more once I'm on the way to work.
Ok
adget! But I'm at work, sitting on my desk chair, and by God this IS work!:-)
Sorry, standing on a crowded trolley (I usu. get a seat) with one hand on the upright hold & the other on my coffee is no place to be e-chatting on my g
Nope
It is raining here: T-storms, with a chance of lemon. I'm glad of it for my yard.
Good, yes?
Same here
His birthday was Wednesday
Taking a day off from one of my projects - feeling a little burned out
looked down at the empty driveway.
Oh, good. Burnout is a Bad Thing. Have fun! I'm gonna be shopping tonight w my son Jeremy. We were going to go last night. I left work about 5:45 (earli
er than my usual), home on Penn Transit, unloaded my backpack and called up to J, grabbed the shopping bags & list, and we went out the back door. And
I had left the car somewhere. Omg.
office. This time I forgot to do that, & blithely walked my normal way to the Penn transit stop.
Jeremy is "be sand"?
Er, "bensanz"?
I hate autocorrect
Depending on where we go for dinner, Harold Stein might join us
"I have to sit down." "i've got the door, Dad." I thought back over the past couple of days. Wednesday I drove up to my therapist at ten, then to a lot
near the office. Then I was scrambling all over trying to send some to a friend by W.Union, and I think that must have driven my usual practice from
my mind. I've left the car before, so now I have made a sign, CAR, that I put on the coat hanger on top of my jacket, or on the inside door handle in my
So I sighed, told J I'd be back in an hour, and took the trolley back to the campus area. Got the car and drove home.
ut, but it's unstaffed at night.
There was a pink slip on my windshield, a receipt for $10. That's their early bird rate for in before 9 a.m. It's an outdoor lot. The gates are never sh
Yes, bensanaz. He's a big manga & anime fan, and of course he gets exposed to a lot of filk. So he took his online moniker, Ben-san, from "Benson, Arizo
na", the good theme song to a bad SF movie.
Where are you thinking of having dinner?
(Please wish my quasi-name-mate a happy birthday f from me.)
Ah
Either a ramen place in Manhattan I've been hearing good things about or a Mexican place that just opened not too far from where I live
Will do
my scraps of katakana are enough to transliterate that much: /raamenbaa/!
Both sounds yummy. There's a ramen place near here. The sign over the front says "RAMEN BAR" and some characters underneath. I don't read Japanese, but
I'm listening to Cat Faber, "Wedding Dance". I love her music.
Ack. I'll shut up & let you talk.!
Your messages are coming through in weird order
ply to the 1st one, #2 and 3 may reach you before you send yours, & show up b4 it on your screen & mine.
Sorry. Part of that may be because the timing is somewhere between have to face and email. So if I send 2 or 3 texts in a row and you start typing a re
Or they may get routed thru different paths on the net and arrive out of order.
If you send me 3 msgs, I get the third then the first. Then the second
Ah
